I have used my approachability and interpersonal skills to help my fellow studentsâ€™ understanding in various topics, being commended on my ability to break complex ideas down into manageable chunks.

projects.name: Mario Kart Scoreboard
projects.description: I developed a web app to show a scoreboard and stats of Mario Kart games. Through this project, I learned a lot about creating a web apps in React and Rust - state management, RESTful APIs, security/firewalls, Cloudflare Tunnels, and much more. It was my first go using Rust as an API - I loved it, especially the compile time safety of SQL query checking. I did a dive into learning how authentication is handled using JWTs, access tokens and refresh tokens. While I know my implementation wasn't the most secure (e.g. using localstorage instead of HTTP only cookies), I learned a lot and it was good enough for my use case.
highlights: Built with React, Rust and Postgres

projects.name: Homelab
projects.description:
I built a server to self-host many pieces of free and open-source software using Proxmox, Docker, and Linux. This has greatly improved my Linux and networking skills, taught me a multitude of server technologies, and given me an insight into security considerations.

I also used a Raspberry Pi to create a remote-control socket switch using relays. It incorporated a Node JS server controlled via my Home Assistant server. This project taught me a lot about hardware and circuits.
